poem:
Title: Iron Threads Between Nations 

Railroad bone,
Where the Urals catch their breath,
War's dark echo pulses.
Great yawn of solitary steel,
Sings songs of quarrel; we feel
Her cold rhythm. A once able man, Wallace,
Seeks answers in numbers that never form -
Fears we fall behind.
Oh, tender is the hope of Ukraine,
In this dance with time.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war at a glance: what we know on day 684 British former defence secretary Ben Wallace warned his successor, Grant Shapps, that the UK was at risk of “falling behind” in its military support for Ukraine because ministers had yet to announce a military aid budget for 2024-5. A section of railroad near the city of Nizhny Tagil in Russia’s Urals region was hit by a “bang”, Tass and RBC news agencies reported. Baza,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
